model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
About that Bluegrass show -- A friend of mine mentioned that he has a cabin he won't be using only about 20 minutes away. Do you and your wife want to stay there so you can make it? Might be a more comfortable way for your wife to camp. Let me know.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Live music events and car repair update', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A mentions attending live music events and needing car repairs, while Speaker B discusses car issues and repair plans.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: I don't blame you! Not so much fun when the ladies are pregnant let me tell you! Are you much of a nightclubber or just straight drinking? ### Speaker A: Eh a little of both depending on how I am feeling. I been going to a lot of live band venues lately ### Speaker B: Are you ever tempted to perform at any of the venues? Get the guitar out perhaps? ### Speaker A: Not really, I haven't spoken with any of those friends for a while. I mostly just go to music venues and I play a lot of music at home ### Speaker B: Yeah ok. Just thinking of going out to see some live music while I'm at home with a pregnancy. Getting a little jealous here let me tell you. ### Speaker A: My car has been running great, thanks to you. ### Speaker B: I'm glad to hear it. Have you been playing your guitar lately or seen any live bands? ### Speaker A: I try to go to a live event every week if I can. I haven't had time recently to play the guitar as I have been needing to use the bus to get about. Takes a lot longer using the bus than a car. ### Speaker B: Yeah I really don't like public transportation if I can avoid it. I'm happy to help with your car any time. Live music is great. I miss going to festivals. ### Speaker A: Did you find out what was wrong with the car in the end? Festivals are great, even better if you can camp out for a few days there. ### Speaker B: Yeah! I love camping out and they have such cool food there and all kinds of drinks. Love to sleep over and wake up to some great music. Yes, it's the alternator, but, don't worry, I'll get you a good price and repair it. ' }
```
